data.title: Maseru, Capital city of Lesotho
data.meta_description: Where in the World is Maseru found? Maseru is the capital of Lesotho (Kingdom of Lesotho), situated in the Southern Africa subregion of Africa. In Maseru, the currency used is South African rand (R), which is the official currency used in Lesotho. The Latitude, Longitude cordinates of Maseru are -29.3167, 27.4833.
data.text: Maseru is the capital and largest city of Lesotho. It is also the capital of the Maseru District. Located on the Caledon River, Maseru lies directly on the Lesothoâ€“South Africa border. Maseru had a population of 330,760 in the 2016 census. The city was established as a police camp and assigned as the capital after the country became a British protectorate in 1869. When the country achieved independence in 1966, Maseru retained its status as capital. The name of the city is a Sesotho word meaning "red sandstones".
